intro: [WRONG START] Hieracussion oxyodon subsp. ganderi, commonly known as the Gander's hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to certain regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and leaves with a rough, hairy texture. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as grasslands and woodland edges. Its flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, while its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a reddish or purplish underside. This subspecies is distinguished by its specific leaf morphology and habitat preferences compared to other members of the Hieracium genus.
